title: Jeremy A. Dubrulle
text:
Hi, I’m Jeremy.
I study plasmid-borne antibiotic resistance and phage defense systems.
I’m also a big fan of nature’s craziest evolution outcomes: Have you seen a male and a female Anglerfish reproduce???
View CV Talks


image: assets/img/JR-logo-circle.webp #image-alt: “Cat with tail shaped as the letter J next to last name initial R”

  
 
 
  
   
  
    
     My GitHub
  
  
    
     PhD PIs
  
  
     Support my talk attendance
  



Hi there! 
Thanks for visiting my website fellow scientist – Let’s dive together in the incredible world of (Bacterio)Phages!
I’m a PhD student in the Fineran group (Phi Lab) at the University of Otago, Dunedin, New Zealand. (https://www.otago.ac.nz/microbiology-and-immunology/our-people/peter-fineran)
I’ve had a diverse academic journey which took me to:

Cambridge (England) - English gap year
Marseille (France) - 1st year Bachelor
Grenoble (France) - 2nd year Bachelor
Canberra (Australia) - 3rd year Bachelor
Reunion (France) - Research assistant in Virology
Dunedin (New Zealand) - Research assistant in Virology/Honours/PhD
Success comes from More info here

Fun fact, I grew up on Reunion Island - you won’t hear that everyday! I bet you a post-doc contract you can’t locate it on a map! Check it out: [Insert website]
When it comes to work, I love improving the efficiency and reproducibility of our workflows. More here
Thanks for being a part of my journey. I’m by no means an expert at anything, but I plan on using this space to learn out loud!
